title: Graphics Designer Job at Smart Partners Consulting Limited
content:
Smart Partners Consulting Limited (SPCL) is an indigenous consulting firm poised on the business model of collaboration to provide professional services of Human Resources and Business Strategy to different companies in various sectors of Nigeria’s economy. It was incorporated in July 2013. Our idea of collaboration and partnership involves the synergy of tested experts in the marketplace to research, identify and proffer solutions to the ever-dynamic needs of our Clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time / On-Site

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a creative, detail-oriented Graphics Designer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate is a visual storyteller who can conceptualize and design compelling content across digital and print platforms.
	You must be skilled in design software, have a strong eye for aesthetics, and be able to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.


Responsibilities


	Develop and design visual content including social media creatives, marketing collateral, website banners, brochures, flyers, logos, and presentations.
	Collaborate with the marketing, social media, and content teams to interpret concepts and translate them into engaging visual designs.
	Create layouts and design templates that are visually appealing and brand-consistent.
	Ensure final graphics and layouts are visually appealing, on-brand, and delivered on time.
	Maintain brand consistency across all design projects.
	Revise designs based on feedback and approval cycles.
	Stay updated on industry trends and tools to bring fresh, modern visuals to campaigns.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, Fine Arts, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
	Proven experience as a Graphics Designer or similar role.
	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator etc.) and other design tools like Canva and CorelDRAW.
	Attention to detail, creativity, and the ability to deliver quality work under deadlines.
	Ability to receive constructive feedback and adjust designs accordingly.
	Strong portfolio showcasing a variety of design projects.
	Excellent visual design skills with a strong understanding of typography, color theory, and layout techniques.
	Sound knowledge of motion graphics or video editing is a plus.


Skills and Competencies:


	Excellent strategic thinking capabilities.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Strong communication and presentation skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Commercial awareness and problem-solving mindset.

title: HR Business Partner Job at FelamokHR Consulting Services Limited
content:
FelamokHR Consulting Services Limited is a Human Resource company with over a decade of business excellence and management consulting practice, head-quartered in Lagos, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Business Partner

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	FelamokHR is a dynamic and forward-thinking human resource consulting firm committed to delivering innovative HR solutions to clients across Nigeria. Our services include recruitment, HR outsourcing, strategy development, talent management, and employee relations. We pride ourselves on professionalism, integrity, and results.
	As we expand our impact and reach, we are seeking a strategic and experienced HR Business Partner (HRBP) to join our growing team in Abuja.
	The HR Business Partner will serve as a strategic advisor to both internal teams and external client organizations. This role is responsible for aligning business objectives with HR solutions, fostering organizational effectiveness, and driving HR initiatives that support client needs and internal operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Partner with client organizations to understand their business strategy and deliver tailored HR solutions.
	Support the design and execution of talent management programs including workforce planning, succession planning, and employee engagement.
	Manage full-cycle recruitment processes for both internal and client roles, ensuring top-tier talent placement.
	Facilitate learning and development initiatives that build leadership and functional capabilities.
	Collaborate with client management teams to drive organizational culture and change initiatives.
	Develop and implement HR policies and procedures in compliance with Nigerian labor laws and client expectations.
	Provide expert guidance on employee relations, performance management, conflict resolution, and disciplinary processes.
	Analyze HR data and metrics to inform decisions and improve service delivery.
	Prepare HR reports, dashboards, and insights for internal and client use.
	Stay abreast of HR best practices, trends, and regulatory changes.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Human Resource Management, Industrial Relations, Psychology, or a related field (Master’s degree or CIPM certification is an added advantage).
	5+ years of progressive HR experience, preferably with consulting or multi-industry exposure.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws and HR compliance standards.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Proven ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.
	High emotional intelligence, problem-solving skills, and strategic thinking.
	Proficiency in HRIS tools and Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month.

What We Offer:


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives
	A supportive and collaborative work environment
	Professional development and growth opportunities
	Exposure to diverse industries and high-impact HR projects.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: hr.greengrassnigeria@gmail.com using “Application – HR Business Partner – Abuja” as the subject of the mail.

Note: FelamokHR Consulting Services Limited is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Assistant HR/IR Manager Job at Lafarge Africa Plc
content:
Lafarge Africa Plc is a member of the LafargeHolcim Group – the biggest building and concrete solutions company in the world. It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant HR/IR Manager

Requisition ID: 14044
Job Location: Mfamosing, Cross River
Job type: Full-time

About the Job
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Working with the HR Business Partner, the role provides support in the delivery of the HR agenda to the business.
	This includes preparing analysis and materials for HR processes e.g. FRC, annual salary review, supporting line managers and acting as assigned Business Partner to certain groups.


What you'll be doing


	Support the implementation of the annual agenda for HR Strategy in line with the functional plan.
	Support the Plant HRBP in the recruitment of non-cadre staff.
	Maintain the personnel administration/records for the site, ensuring on-time delivery, accuracy of information provided and legal compliance (especially for annual social statements, and individual contracts).
	Coach and equip supervisors to effectively manage their people in line with people plans e.g. performance management 
	Support production of HR data reporting and analysis to satisfy routine and ad-hoc organisational requirements 
	Working with the Head of HR, Industrial/IR, manage employee and industrial relations for the plant and provide support and guidance to the Plant HRBP.
	Manage the interface with relevant statutory bodies and trade associations in the locality as agreed with the Plant HRBP in conjunction with the Head of HR Industrial/IR. 
	Support the development and continuous improvement of HR systems and policies in line with best practices.
	Work with the Head of HR Industrial and Plant HRBP to identify opportunities and areas of improvement to support improved organisational and people performance.
	Support the Plant HRBP in the deployment of policies for effective employee / industrial relations management across the plant.
	Support the Plant HRBP on employee and industrial relations issues to ensure a peaceful industrial atmosphere.
	Liaising with the Head of HR Industrial/IR, support Plant HRBP in resolving industrial relations crisis in the plant.
	Provide necessary support for the Plant HRBP during salary negotiations.
	Under the direction of the Plant, HRBP manages projects as required.
	Monitor the social climate in the plant and provide regular feedback to the Plant HRBP and Head of HR Industrial/IR.
	Collaborate with and support other roles within the O & HR function as required.


What we are looking for 


	Graduate in any discipline, preferably the Social Sciences
	2 - 3 years of relevant HR BP or generalist experience in an Industrial setting 
	CIPD certification added advantage 
	Excellent influencing and coaching skills
	A solution-based approach to problem-solving
	Project management skills
	Tenacious and flexible – open to change.


Behavioral competence:


	Customer focused
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to prioritise and work well under pressure
	Desire to learn.
